question: Who had two sons?
answer1: a rich old man

question: Who lived with the old man, and helped him to look after his property?
answer1: the elder

question: What did the young man's father do at the end of the week?
answer1: counted up the money they had made, and rubbed his hands with delight

question: Why was the young man's father delighted?
answer1: He saw how big the pile of gold in the strong iron chest was becoming.

question: Why did the young man's father want to buy a bigger chest?
answer1: The chest was going to be full soon.
answer2: The chest would not fit all of their money soon.

question: Where did the old man go to one day?
answer1: to the city

question: Who came up to the old man for a gossip?
answer1: the landlady

question: How did the old man feel after the landlady asked about his daughter-in-law?
answer1: confused

question: Why was the old man confused after the landlady asked about his daughter-in-law?
answer1: He did not have a daughter-in-law.
answer2: He did not know anyone who got married.

question: How did the landlady feel after the old man denied the rumors?
answer1: alarmed

question: Who was the prettiest girl in the whole country side?
answer1: Miguel's daughter

question: What did the old man's handsome son do every week?
answer1: buying or selling

question: What did the son and Miguel's daughter do one fine morning?
answer1: went to the little church on top of the hill, and were married

question: How did the old man feel after he found out his son deceived him?
answer1: angry

question: Why didn't the son tell his father about his wife?
answer1: She was poor.

question: Where did the son go after his father kicked him out?
answer1: in a cave on the side of his hill

question: How did the son feel after his father kicked him out?
answer1: sad

question: How did the old man find out about his son's wife?
answer1: heard from the landlady
answer2: asked the landlady to explain more

question: Why did the son always put off telling his father about his wife?
answer1: hoping always for a better opportunity, and now this was the end

question: What did the old man do as soon as the sun rose?
answer1: sent a messenger into the great city with orders to bring back the younger brother

question: Why did the old man bring back the younger brother?
answer1: informed him that he was now his only heir, and would inherit all his lands and money, and that he was to come and live at home, and to help manage the property

question: Why was the younger brother very pleased at the thought of becoming such a rich man?
answer1: The brothers had never cared much for each other.

question: Why would the younger brother rather have stayed where he was?
answer1: He soon got tired of the country, and longed for a town life.

question: How will the younger brother feel after he finds out that he is the heir?
answer1: very pleased

question: What happened after the younger brother came home to help manage the property?
answer1: The crops were not so good as they had been, and the old man gave orders that some fine houses he was building in the city should be left unfinished.

question: Why did the old man give orders to leave some houses to be left unfinished?
answer1: It would take all the savings to complete them.

question: What happened after the elder son left his home?
answer1: He would never even hear his name mentioned, and died at last without ever seeing his face, leaving to the younger, as he had promised, all his lands, as well as his money.

question: Why did the elder son grow poorer and poorer?
answer1: He gave his money to his younger brother.

question: What did the elder son and his wife do after they grew poorer and poorer?
answer1: looking out for something to do, and never spent a penny that they could help

question: Why was luck against the elder son and his wife?
answer1: At the time of his father's death they had hardly bread to eat or clothes to cover them.

question: Why did the elder son swallow his pride and crossed the mountains to his old home?
answer1: He could not bear to watch his children becoming weaker day by day.

question: How did the elder son feel after he realized his children were getting weaker?
answer1: sad

question: What did the elder son ask for?
answer1: unfinished houses

question: What did the elder son want to do with his younger brother's unfinished houses?
answer1: make them watertight, so that his wife and children can live in them

question: Why did the elder son want his younger brother's unfinished houses?
answer1: save their money on rent
answer2: to not spend money on rent

question: What did the younger brother do after he listened to his elder brother's request?
answer1: gave him the houses that he asked for

question: How will the elder son feel after his brother gives him the houses?
answer1: happy

question: What did the younger brother do after he began to feel lonely?
answer1: decided to get married

question: Who was very wealthy and greedy?
answer1: the younger brother's wife

question: How was the younger brother's wife very greedy?
answer1: However much she had, she always wanted more.

question: How did the younger brother feel after he got married?
answer1: unhappy

question: Why did the younger brother regret the day that he had first seen his wife?
answer1: Her meanness and shabby ways put him to shame.

question: What did the bride want to do a few months after she got married?
answer1: wanted to go into the city and buy herself some new dresses

question: What did the bride plan to do after she finished shopping?
answer1: pay a visit to her unknown sister-in-law, and rest for a bit

question: What did the bride resolve to do after she saw the houses?
answer1: resolved to get them for herself

question: What will happen after the bride decides to buy the unfinished houses?
answer1: Her husband will not allow her to buy the houses.
answer2: Her husband will not want to buy the houses.

question: Where did the bride's unknown sister-in-law live?
answer1: in the unfinished houses

question: Why did the bride want to buy the unfinished houses?
answer1: This lady saw that by spending some money the houses could be made as splendid as they were originally intended to be.

question: How will the wife feel after the younger brother refused to buy the unfinished houses?
answer1: very angry

question: What did the wife do after she reached home?
answer1: went straight to her husband, and told him that he must get back those houses from his brother

question: What did the wife want to turn the unfinished houses into?
answer1: a palace as fine as the king's

question: Why didn't her husband want to buy the houses?
answer1: He had long since made a gift of them to his brother.

question: Why did the wife get angry at her husband?
answer1: He did not allow her to buy the houses.
answer2: She did not get what she wanted.

question: What did the husband suggest because he could not buy the unfinished houses?
answer1: buy houses in some other part of the town

question: Who had lived at the unfinished houses for many years?
answer1: his brother

question: Why did the younger brother do what his wife wished?
answer1: She lamented all day and all night, till the poor man was nearly worried to death.

question: Why did the wife think it was absurd for her husband to decline her request?
answer1: The gift was worth nothing.

question: What will happen after the younger brother summons his brother in a court of law?
answer1: The judge will decide in favor of the poor man.

question: What will happen after the husband is not able to get the unfinished houses back?
answer1: His wife will keep trying to fight for the unfinished houses.
answer2: His wife will not give up the houses.

question: How will the wife feel after the judge favors the poor man?
answer1: furious

question: Why did the wife decide to not rest until she got the unfinished houses?
answer1: She was very greedy.

question: How will the husband feel after his wife tries to get what she wants?
answer1: tired and ashamed

question: Where did the younger brother and elder brother have their case before the highest judge of all?
answer1: in the city of Evora

question: What did the younger brother regret not doing?
answer1: putting a stop to it in the beginning

question: Why didn't the elder brother have a horse or plenty of food to eat?
answer1: He was poor.

question: Why did the two brothers stay at a farmer's house?
answer1: It was nighttime.

question: Who had planned to have a particularly good supper as it was his wife's birthday?
answer1: a farmer

question: Why did the elder brother ask timidly if he might spend the night in a corner?
answer1: He was worried the farmer would decline.
answer2: He was not rich like his brother.

question: What did the farmer's wife want from the elder brother?
answer1: one of the onions

question: What will happen after the farmer's wife eats the onion?
answer1: She will feel sick.

question: Why did the farmer believe the elder brother poisoned his wife?
answer1: She was in pain.

question: How did the farmer feel after he believed the elder brother poisoned his wife?
answer1: angry

question: What did the younger brother suggest to the farmer?
answer1: accuse his brother at Evora
answer2: file a law-suit against his brother

question: Why did the elder brother fear more ill-treatment?
answer1: He was accused by his brother and the farmer.
answer2: He was going to court for two cases.

question: Who were carefully skirting the swamp at some distance off?
answer1: the two horsemen

question: What made the mule laden with baggage stuck?
answer1: The road was so thick with mud.

question: What did the two horsemen do after the muleteer appealed to them?
answer1: paid no heed to his cries

question: What will happen after the elder brother helps the muleteer?
answer1: The muleteer will be mad at him.
answer2: The elder brother will ruin the mule.

question: Why was the muleteer mad at the elder brother?
answer1: The elder brother removed the mule's tail.
answer2: The elder brother accidentally took the mule's tail.

question: Why did the muleteer and the elder brother set about finding some sout logs of wood?
answer1: His frantic struggles had broken his bridle, and he was deeper in than ever.

question: How did the muleteer feel after the elder brother ruined his mule?
answer1: mad

question: Who lived near by had begged to be carried out and to be laid at the foot of the wall?
answer1: an old sick man

question: Why did the elder brother want to die?
answer1: He had struggled so long, and was so very, very tired.

question: Why did the two young men take the elder brother before the judge?
answer1: He had killed their father.

question: Where did the two young men take the elder brother?
answer1: the court-house

question: How did the two young men feel after the elder brother landed on their father?
answer1: mad

question: How did the elder brother fall on the old man?
answer1: He jumped from the wall.

question: What verdict did the judge make after he heard the story about the unfinished houses?
answer1: The elder brother would keep his property.
answer2: The younger brother had to pay a thousand pounds.

question: How did the younger brother feel after the judge made his verdict?
answer1: angry

question: Why was the younger brother angry at the judge's verdict?
answer1: He lost money.
answer2: He did not get his houses back.

question: Why wasn't the elder brother safe yet?
answer1: The farmer filed a law-suit against him.
answer2: The elder brother still had another case.

question: What did the farmer need to give to the elder brother?
answer1: twelve hundred pounds

question: What did the judge ask the farmer?
answer1: if the wife was dead before the farmer left the house

question: What did the judge tell the muleteer?
answer1: he had proved himself mean and ungrateful for the help that had been given him

question: How was the muleteer ungrateful and mean to the elder brother?
answer1: The muleteer did not appreciate his help.
answer2: The muleteer got angry over a small mistake.

question: What did the muleteer need to give to the elder brother?
answer1: the mule

question: What did the young men decide to do?
answer1: pay eight hundred pounds

question: How did the elder brother feel after the judge completed all of the verdicts?
answer1: happy

question: What did the elder brother do after the cases were over?
answer1: rode the mule home, and brought back to his family enough money to keep them in comfort to the end of their days
